thoughts.text: The 'execute_shell' command is returning too much output. We can try using the 'read_file' command again with a different file to see if it is working correctly.
thoughts.reasoning: If the 'execute_shell' command is returning too much output, it is possible that there is an issue with the command itself or that we are not using it correctly. By using the 'read_file' command again with a different file, we can see if there is an issue with the command itself or if it is related to the file we were trying to read earlier.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'read_file' command with the argument '/usr/share/dict/words' to read the contents of the /usr/share/dict/words file
thoughts.criticism: I should make sure to select a file that we have permission to read and that is not critical to the system.
thoughts.speak: The 'execute_shell' command is returning too much output. We can try using the 'read_file' command again with a different file to see if it is working correctly.
